info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 20 at 3:01AM CDT until March 20 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS North Platte NE
info.description:
...NEAR CRITICAL TO CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS POSSIBLE THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING AND AGAIN FRIDAY AFTERNOON INTO FRIDAY EVENING...
...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND GUSTY WINDS FOR THE EASTERN PANHANDLE AND SANDHILLS...
The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a Red Flag Warning for low relative humidity and gusty winds, which is in effect from noon CDT /11 AM MDT/ today to 9 PM CDT /8 PM MDT/ this evening. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued. This Fire Weather Watch for low relative humidity and gusty winds is in effect from Friday afternoon through Friday evening.
* AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 204 Eastern Panhandle/Crescent Lake NWR and Fire Weather Zone 206 Sandhills/Valentine NWR/Nebraska National Forest.
* TIMING...Noon through 9 PM CDT Thursday.
* WINDS...West 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 45 mph.
* RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 13 percent.
* TEMPERATURES...Up to 62.
* LIGHTNING...Not Expected.
* IMPACTS...Any fire starts have a good potential to spread rapidly and may be difficult to control.
info.instruction:
A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

parameter.value: RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON CDT /11 AM MDT/ TODAY TO 9 PM CDT /8 PM MDT/ THIS EVENING FOR LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND GUSTY WINDS FOR THE EASTERN PANHANDLE, SANDHILLS, AND PORTIONS OF NORTH CENTRAL NEBRASKA

area.areaDesc: Eastern Panhandle/Crescent Lake NWR; Sandhills/Valentine NWR/Nebraska National Forest
